title: Barr Seeking Foreign Help on Origins of Russia Probe
summary: President spoke to Australian prime minister about helping the attorney general. Attorney General William Barr has asked President Trump to introduce him to a number of foreign officials who he believes may have information relevant to the Justice Department's review of the origins of the Russia investigation and has held overseas meetings with some of them, a department official said Monday.

title: NewLink Genetics to Merge With Lumos Pharma
summary: Resume Subscription. NewLink Genetics Corp . has agreed to merge with Lumos Pharma Inc. in a stock swap.

title: New York City Officer Was Killed by Friendly Fire
summary: Plainclothes officer died during a violent struggle with a suspect in the Bronx a day earlier. A plainclothes police officer who died during a violent struggle with a suspect in the Bronx was accidentally shot and killed by friendly fire, the New York Police Department said.

title: World Bank Loans Subsidize Chinese Repression
summary: Democracies have the power to stop billions until Beijing stops oppressing Uighurs and other groups.. Last week Secretary of State Mike Pompeo urged Central Asian foreign ministers to "resist China's demands to repatriate Uighurs" back to China, where the Communist government has subjected them to forced internment, cultural and religious "re-education," and constant surveillance. Beijing claims to be fighting terrorism, but it looks more like an effort to wipe out a culture. In July Mr. Pompeo called Beijing's campaign against the mostly Muslim Uighurs the "stain of the century."

title: Teachers Want Higher Pay, but Pensions Swallow Up the Money
summary: Offer them a deal: a raise in wages in exchange for forgoing defined-benefit retirement plans.. A record number of American public-school teachers have walked off the job over the past two years-and now another strike looms in Chicago. Chief among the teachers' demands is higher pay. They're often right-teacher pay is too low-but for the wrong reasons.

title: Put the Playoffs Back in Waking Hours
summary: Kids can't take in the national pastime long after bedtime.. The Major League Baseball postseason begins Tuesday with the National League Wild Card Game. On the East Coast, the first pitch will be at 8:08 p.m., which in our house is a problem. Simply put, the game starts too late. This is true of almost all postseason games, and baseball ought to do something about it.

title: There's Hope for Freedom, Even in China
summary: As Hong Kong highlights Beijing's moral failings, the markets may be seeing its economic limitations.. Hong Kong

title: Why Foreign Influence Is on the Rise
summary: Corrupt officials and 'princelings' grow more important in our globalized politics.. "Against the insidious wiles of foreign influence," George Washington warned in his Farewell Address, "the jealousy of a free people ought to be constantly awake, since history and experience prove that foreign influence is one of the most baneful foes of republican government." Those words have rarely seemed more relevant than now, when both the president and the front-runner for the nomination to challenge him are embroiled in a scandal that began with attempts by Ukrainian figures to manipulate Washington politics and policy.

title: Pelosi's Permanent Impeachment
summary: By proceeding by fiat instead of a full House vote, the speaker sets a terrible precedent.. Bill Clinton was the first president to embrace the "permanent campaign," meaning a White House always in full election mode. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has now made her own dubious contribution to American history, by setting up the possibility of a Congress in permanent impeachment mode.

title: Opera Star Jessye Norman Dies at 74
summary: Renowned soprano won four Grammys and a National Medal of Arts. Jessye Norman, the renowned international opera star whose passionate soprano voice won her four Grammy Awards, the National Medal of Arts and the Kennedy Center Honor, has died, according to family spokesperson Gwendolyn Quinn. She was 74.

title: 'Contest for Liberty' Review: Commanding the Continentals
summary: Washington perfected a disciplined yet consensual style of military leadership. He negotiated with his men as much as he coerced and inspired them.. By the time he was captured at Yorktown in October 1781, the Hessian officer Johann Ewald had spent five years fighting alongside the British Redcoats against the rebellious former subjects of King George III.

title: Notable & Quotable: Pelosi Against Impeachment
summary: 'The Republicans in the House are paralyzed with hatred of President Clinton.'. Rep. Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif.) speaking on the House floor, Dec. 18, 1998:

title: Communist China Turns 70
summary: Its demand for economic and political control is inspiring a backlash.. China's Communist Party on Tuesday marks the 70th anniversary of its 1949 revolution, and the fireworks and military parades will celebrate the country's rise to become the world's second largest economy. Yet there is no denying that this anniversary comes with a paradoxical unease about China's place in the world. China is more powerful but less free than it was a decade ago and the world views its external aggression with growing concern.

title: California's Foreign-Oil Problem
summary: Why the Golden State is dependent on the Saudis, unlike most of America.. Following the attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities last month, many forecasters warned that gas prices would spike. Yet prices have hardly budged-except in California, where they are surging due to policies that have made the state more reliant on foreign oil.

title: Brave Voting in Afghanistan
summary: Facing Taliban threats, voters took risks simply by showing up.. The voting totals won't be known for weeks, yet the two leading candidates for Afghan president are both declaring victory. The current occupant, President Ashraf Ghani, last week ruled out a renewed power-sharing deal, such as the one brokered after the disputed 2014 election. His rival, Chief Executive Abdullah Abdullah, warned Thursday about electoral fraud.

title: Egg Glut Deepens Problems in Farm Economy
summary: Shares in top egg producer Cal-Maine Foods take a hit, as per-dozen prices decline. Too many hens laying too many eggs are pushing down prices for the consumer staple, hurting sales at producers such as Cal-Maine Foods Inc. and adding more stress to the U.S. farm economy.

title: New York City Poverty Rate Falls to Historic Lows
summary: Economic growth, low unemployment and city programs help push rate to lows not seen since 1970s. The number of people living below the poverty line in New York City dropped to historic lows as the economy continued to grow, according to newly released federal census data and the mayor's office.

title: Judge Dismisses States' Challenge to Trump Tax Overhaul
summary: New York, New Jersey, Connecticut and Maryland claimed part of the tax law was unconstitutional because it was aimed at blue states. A federal judge on Monday dismissed a lawsuit filed by four East Coast states that said part of the 2017 federal tax overhaul was unconstitutional because it was politically motivated.

title: Rep. Chris Collins, Charged in Insider-Trading Case, Resigns
summary: Republican congressman from New York faces federal charges involving his son and a pharmaceutical company. U.S. Rep. Christopher Collins of New York resigned Monday ahead of his expected guilty plea to charges related to an insider-trading case involving his son and an Australian biotechnology company.

title: Hillary Clinton and Ukraine
summary: A letter released Monday raises questions beyond the Bidens.. The Biden clan still needs to explain why a vice president's son was enjoying a $50,000-per-month gig for which his principal qualification appears to have been his last name. But Joe Biden isn't the only pillar of the Democratic establishment who won't enjoy the new spotlight on American relations with Ukraine. And President Donald Trump isn't the only one who wants a fuller accounting of that country's role in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

title: Vape-Shop Owners Sue Massachusetts Over Ban
summary: Public officials are trying to rein in public-health problem; vaping industry says bans are off target. The owners of six Massachusetts vape shops are suing the state over a new temporary ban on vaping-product sales, escalating the tension between retail businesses and public officials trying to address a nationwide public-health problem.

title: See What You Want in the Trump Transcript
summary: You consider pursuing impeachment "on this thin gruel" problematic. However, this gruel may not be so thin.. Regarding your editorial "The Ukraine Transcript Fizzle" (Sept. 26): First of all, the "transcript" wasn't a verbatim transcript. The language is concerning because there are a number of troubling revelations: What's Rudy Giuliani, President Trump's personal attorney, doing in trying to shake down a foreign entity for "dirt" on Joe Biden and son? Who gave Mr. Giuliani the authority to act for the U.S.?

title: America Needs Stronger Laws Against Defamation
summary: Rather than lamenting how the maligning of a good man will continue, we should ask ourselves why we allow it. We've let people lie to Congress without consequence.. Regarding Peggy Noonan's "Why They'll Never Stop Targeting Kavanaugh" (Declarations, Sept. 21): Rather than lamenting how the maligning of a good man will continue, we should ask ourselves why we allow it. We've let people lie to Congress without consequence. The Justice Department hasn't prosecuted a single person referred by Sen. Chuck Grassley for false statements. Our libel and slander laws are so weak as to be meaningless if the target is a public figure or the purveyors are members of the press. If you reward bad behavior, you will surely get more of it. Our republic would be a better place if people had to be a little more judicious about trashing a person's reputation.

title: It's Right to Ask Depressed Patients About Gun Access
summary: Asking patients whether or not they have guns in their home is sound practice, especially when dealing with someone who has a depressive disorder and suicidal ideation.. Regarding Jim Trageser's Sept. 25 letter "Doctors' Activism Should Focus on Treatment": Asking patients whether or not they have guns in their home is sound practice, especially when dealing with someone who has a depressive disorder and suicidal ideation. Access to guns increases the risk of suicide in that situation. In my more than 50 years of practice, I have lowered that risk by asking that question, and none has taken offense.

title: Cryptocurrency Exchanges Including Coinbase Disclose Ratings of Digital Assets
summary: Businesses to score which assets can be traded without ire of regulators. The U.S.'s biggest cryptocurrency exchanges have developed a system to rate which digital assets are probably securities that can't be traded on their venues-and which likely can.

summary: Strategy involving Endo International, Johnson & Johnson and other drugmakers could shrink one of largest, most complex cases in U.S. history. title: The Only Thing Rappers and Queen Elizabeth II Have in Common
summary: Babushkas, the ornate headscarves worn by Russian grandmothers, have been showing up on fashionable NFL players, rappers like A$AP Rocky and male runway models. What's behind this curious trend?. CAM NEWTON, the quarterback for the Carolina Panthers, has sat out the past two games with a foot injury. Though not a great loss for Panthers' fans-backup quarterback Kyle Allen is faring just fine-Mr. Newton's absence has devastated fans of his post-game outfits. Week after week, the three-time Pro Bowler is known for strolling into press conferences in outfits that range from peacock-worthy to preposterous. He's worn a flat-brim fedora the color of Jim Carrey's "Mask" costume, a sportcoat with the sleeves cut off, even a fez. Reader, the man has worn a fez. (The Panthers organization did not respond to requests to interview Mr. Newton.)

title: College Football Overlooked Daniel Jones. Now He's a Budding NFL Star
summary: The obsession with finding the best quarterbacks produces a system that can fail to identify the best quarterbacks-missing prospects who blossom later on. By the time he had morphed into a peanut-butter stuffed, 6-foot-5 high-school senior, almost all the college coaches tasked with recruiting the best players in the country had already moved on.
